item.title: {Fwd: New Python tutorials on Real Python}
item.description: Hey there,Thereâs always something going on over at realpython.com as far as Python tutorials go.Hereâs what you may have missed this past week:Object-Oriented Programming (OOP) in Python 3In this tutorial, you'll learn all about object-oriented programming (OOP) in Python. You'll learn the basics of the OOP paradigm and cover concepts like classes and inheritance. You'll also see to how instantiate an object from a class:â realpython.com/python3-object-oriented-programmin...

item.title: {I'll be emailing you weekly}
item.description: Hey, everyone.This is a new weekly email I'll be sending out on Friday to complement our early-week newsletter from Jess.I want to keep folks in the loop about the most recent changes to DEV and Forem. I'll keep these emails short, and often actionable. As an community-driven open source organization, we have no shortage of new things going on to and ways to get involved. We merged about 100 pull requests this past week, a couple that stand out to me personally are:Improved tag index design. T...

item.description: Hey there,Iâll never forget launching my first open-source project and sharing it on Redditâ¦I had spent a couple of days at my parentsâ place over Christmas that year and decided to use some of my spare time to work on a Python library I christened Schedule.The idea behind Schedule was very simple and had a narrow focus (I find that that thatâs always a good idea for libraries by the way):Developers would use it like a timer to periodically call a function inside their Python prog...

item.title: {=?utf-8?Q?=5B=F0=9F=90=8DPyTricks=5D=3A_Python=27s_namedtuples_ca?= =?utf-8?Q?n_be_a_great_alternative_to_defining_a_class_manually?=}
item.description:
# Why Python is Great: Namedtuples # Using namedtuple is way shorter than # defining a class manually: >>> from collections import namedtuple >>> Car = namedtuple('Car', 'color mileage')
# Our new "Car" class works as expected: >>> my_car = Car('red', 3812.4) >>> my_car.color 'red' >>> my_car.mileage 3812.4
# We get a nice string repr for free: >>> my_car Car(color='red' , mileage=3812.4)
# Like tuples, namedtuples are immutable: >&gt...
